## Description {#details}

Each Scheduling boundary is associated with ready queues.

It tracks the current cycle in whichever direction at has moved, and maintains the state of &quot;hazards&quot; and other interlocks at the current cycle.

Definition at line 127 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-h">VLIWMachineScheduler.h</a>.

### checkHazard() {#af46e7864fe409ea4ae6b1b56e8baa9a1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ConvergingVLIWScheduler::VLIWSchedBoundary::checkHazard (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; SU)</>}>
Does this SU have a hazard within the current instruction group.

The scheduler supports two modes of hazard recognition. The first is the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/schedulehazardrecognizer">ScheduleHazardRecognizer</a> API. It is a fully general hazard recognizer that supports highly complicated in-order reservation tables (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scoreboardhazardrecognizer">ScoreboardHazardRecognizer</a>) and arbitrary target-specific logic.

The second is a streamlined mechanism that checks for hazards based on simple counters that the scheduler itself maintains. It explicitly checks for instruction dispatch limitations, including the number of micro-ops that can dispatch per cycle.

TODO: Also check whether the SU must start a new group.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-h/#l00189">189</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-h">VLIWMachineScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-cpp/#l00358">358</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-cpp">VLIWMachineScheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### pickOnlyChoice() {#aa18aa1832f12c6ca7ee45d51101385c8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SUnit &#42; ConvergingVLIWScheduler::VLIWSchedBoundary::pickOnlyChoice ()</>}>
If this queue only has one ready candidate, return it.

As a side effect, advance the cycle until at least one node is ready. If multiple instructions are ready, return NULL.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-h/#l00201">201</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-h">VLIWMachineScheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-cpp/#l00481">481</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/vliwmachinescheduler-cpp">VLIWMachineScheduler.cpp</a>.

### releasePending() {#a7f64e612634009b7ced96fbf06f6b445}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void ConvergingVLIWScheduler::VLIWSchedBoundary::releasePending ()">
Release pending ready nodes in to the available queue.

This makes them visible to heuristics.
